bug.author: lazystone
bug.description: Steps/Code to reproduce bug docker pull nvcr.io/nvidia/nemo:v1.0.0b3 Error response from daemon: manifest for nvcr.io/nvidia/nemo:v1.0.0b3 not found: manifest unknown: manifest unknown Similar to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/NeMo/issues/1498>#1498</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Do you mean v1.0.0b2? I haven't seen a b3 version yet, but there is a branch called r1.0.0b3.
Well, I assumed since there is <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/NeMo/releases/tag/v1.0.0b3>v1.0.0b3</denchmark-link> release, then is should be docker image for that version.

Sorry, I missed the 1.0.0b3 release, you are correct! In the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/NeMo/tree/v1.0.0b3>v1.0.0b3 README</denchmark-link> there appear to be updated instructions but it appears your command is correct so the docker container is indeed missing. I was unable to retrieve it as well. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47190785/102230326-bf583400-3eba-11eb-803f-f30cf7b1bd4f.png></denchmark-link>
Try pulling nvcr.io/nvidia/nemo:1.0.0b3, it should be live now.
